channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Data Factors for Better Compositional Generalization
item.description: However, in contrast to this poor performance, state-of-the-art models trained on larger and more general datasets show better generalization ability.

item.title: Bias Runs Deep: Implicit Reasoning Biases in Persona-Assigned LLMs
item.description: These can be observed as abstentions in the model responses, e. g., 'As a Black person, I am unable to answer this question as it requires math knowledge', and generally result in a substantial drop in performance on reasoning tasks.

item.title: Rethinking Benchmark and Contamination for Language Models with Rephrased Samples
item.description: Many have raised concerns about the trustworthiness of public benchmarks due to potential contamination in pre-training or fine-tuning datasets.

item.title: Massive Editing for Large Language Models via Meta Learning
item.description: While large language models (LLMs) have enabled learning knowledge from the pre-training corpora, the acquired knowledge may be fundamentally incorrect or outdated over time, which necessitates rectifying the knowledge of the language model (LM) after the training.

item.title: A Comprehensive Summarization and Evaluation of Feature Refinement Modules for CTR Prediction
item.description: In addition, we present a new architecture of assigning independent FR modules to separate sub-networks for parallel CTR models, as opposed to the conventional method of inserting a shared FR module on top of the embedding layer.

item.title: A 3D generative model of pathological multi-modal MR images and segmentations
item.description: The proposed joint imaging-segmentation generative model is shown to generate high-fidelity synthetic images and associated segmentations, with the ability to combine pathologies.

item.title: SEMQA: Semi-Extractive Multi-Source Question Answering
item.description: Experimenting with several LLMs in various settings, we find this task to be surprisingly challenging, demonstrating the importance of QuoteSum for developing and studying such consolidation capabilities.

item.title: Image-Based Virtual Try-On: A Survey
item.description: In addition to quantitative and qualitative evaluation of current open-source methods, we also utilize ControlNet to fine-tune a recent large image generation model (PBE) to show future potentials of large-scale models on image-based virtual try-on task.

item.title: Army of Thieves: Enhancing Black-Box Model Extraction via Ensemble based sample selection
item.description: In this work, we explore the usage of an ensemble of deep learning models as our thief model.

item.title: Robust and Communication-Efficient Federated Domain Adaptation via Random Features
item.description: As a result, there is a growing trend to leverage federated learning (FL) techniques to train large ML models in a distributed and collaborative manner.

item.title: Predicting Properties of Nodes via Community-Aware Features
item.description: A community structure that is often present in complex networks plays an important role not only in their formation but also shapes dynamics of these networks, affecting properties of their nodes.

item.title: Towards Deeper, Lighter and Interpretable Cross Network for CTR Prediction
item.description: It is crucial to effectively model feature interactions to improve the prediction performance of CTR models.

item.title: Using large language models to study human memory for meaningful narratives
item.description: One of the most impressive achievements of the AI revolution is the development of large language models that can generate meaningful text and respond to instructions in plain English with no additional training necessary.

item.title: VET: Visual Error Tomography for Point Cloud Completion and High-Quality Neural Rendering
item.description: In our results, we show that our approach can improve the quality of a point cloud obtained by structure from motion and thus increase novel view synthesis quality significantly.

item.title: FEIR: Quantifying and Reducing Envy and Inferiority for Fair Recommendation of Limited Resources
item.description: In settings such as e-recruitment and online dating, recommendation involves distributing limited opportunities, calling for novel approaches to quantify and enforce fairness.

item.title: Beyond Size: How Gradients Shape Pruning Decisions in Large Language Models
item.description: Prior approaches such as Weights Magnitude, SparseGPT, and Wanda, either concentrated solely on weights or integrated weights with activations for sparsity.

item.title: Be Careful When Evaluating Explanations Regarding Ground Truth
item.description: Evaluating explanations of image classifiers regarding ground truth, e. g. segmentation masks defined by human perception, primarily evaluates the quality of the models under consideration rather than the explanation methods themselves.

item.title: Learning Linear Gaussian Polytree Models with Interventions
item.description: We present a consistent and highly scalable local approach to learn the causal structure of a linear Gaussian polytree using data from interventional experiments with known intervention targets.

item.title: MixTEA: Semi-supervised Entity Alignment with Mixture Teaching
item.description: More importantly, in pseudo mapping learning, we propose a bi-directional voting (BDV) strategy that fuses the alignment decisions in different directions to estimate the uncertainty via the joint matching confidence score.

item.title: AI-accelerated Discovery of Altermagnetic Materials
item.description: Altermagnetism, a new magnetic phase, has been theoretically proposed and experimentally verified to be distinct from ferromagnetism and antiferromagnetism.

item.title: Identifying Semantic Component for Robust Molecular Property Prediction
item.description: Specifically, we first formulate the data generation process from the atom level to the molecular level, where the latent space is split into SI substructures, SR substructures, and SR atom variables.

item.title: Training CLIP models on Data from Scientific Papers
item.description: Contrastive Language-Image Pretraining (CLIP) models are able to capture the semantic relationship of images and texts and have enabled a wide range of applications, from image retrieval to classification.

item.title: FetMRQC: an open-source machine learning framework for multi-centric fetal brain MRI quality control
item.description: We present FetMRQC, an open-source machine-learning framework for automated image quality assessment and quality control that is robust to domain shifts induced by the heterogeneity of clinical data.

item.title: Improving Pacing in Long-Form Story Planning
item.description: Existing LLM-based systems for writing long-form stories or story outlines frequently suffer from unnatural pacing, whether glossing over important events or over-elaborating on insignificant details, resulting in a jarring experience for the reader.

item.title: GCS-ICHNet: Assessment of Intracerebral Hemorrhage Prognosis using Self-Attention with Domain Knowledge Integration
item.description: Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH) is a severe condition resulting from damaged brain blood vessel ruptures, often leading to complications and fatalities.

item.title: On Characterizing the Evolution of Embedding Space of Neural Networks using Algebraic Topology
item.description: We study how the topology of feature embedding space changes as it passes through the layers of a well-trained deep neural network (DNN) through Betti numbers.

item.title: RDGCN: Reinforced Dependency Graph Convolutional Network for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA) is dedicated to forecasting the sentiment polarity of aspect terms within sentences.

item.title: Lidar Annotation Is All You Need
item.description: One of the fundamental tasks in computer vision is semantic image segmentation, which is vital for precise object delineation.

item.title: Self-Supervised Learning for Visual Relationship Detection through Masked Bounding Box Reconstruction
item.description: We present a novel self-supervised approach for representation learning, particularly for the task of Visual Relationship Detection (VRD).

item.title: LongQLoRA: Efficient and Effective Method to Extend Context Length of Large Language Models
item.description: We present LongQLoRA, an efficient and effective method to extend context length of large language models with less training resources.

item.title: SODAWideNet -- Salient Object Detection with an Attention augmented Wide Encoder Decoder network without ImageNet pre-training
item.description: To achieve a shallower network, we increase the receptive field from the beginning of the network using a combination of dilated convolutions and self-attention.

item.title: Hierarchically Gated Recurrent Neural Network for Sequence Modeling
item.description: Transformers have surpassed RNNs in popularity due to their superior abilities in parallel training and long-term dependency modeling.

item.title: How Abstract Is Linguistic Generalization in Large Language Models? Experiments with Argument Structure
item.description: We find that LLMs perform well in generalizing the distribution of a novel noun argument between related contexts that were seen during pre-training (e. g., the active object and passive subject of the verb spray), succeeding by making use of the semantically-organized structure of the embedding space for word embeddings.

item.title: Cross-Silo Federated Learning Across Divergent Domains with Iterative Parameter Alignment
item.description: Learning from the collective knowledge of data dispersed across private sources can provide neural networks with enhanced generalization capabilities.

item.title: Rethinking Event-based Human Pose Estimation with 3D Event Representations
item.description: To address this issue and to unlock the 3D potential of event information, we introduce two 3D event representations: the Rasterized Event Point Cloud (RasEPC) and the Decoupled Event Voxel (DEV).

item.title: DAMEX: Dataset-aware Mixture-of-Experts for visual understanding of mixture-of-datasets
item.description: Construction of a universal detector poses a crucial question: How can we most effectively train a model on a large mixture of datasets?

item.title: CAIS-DMA: A Decision-Making Assistant for Collaborative AI Systems
item.description: This paper introduces a new methodology to automatically support the decision-making process in CAIS when the system experiences performance degradation after a disruptive event.

item.title: A Hierarchical Spatial Transformer for Massive Point Samples in Continuous Space
item.description: However, designing a transformer for massive spatial points is non-trivial due to several challenges, including implicit long-range and multi-scale dependency on irregular points in continuous space, a non-uniform point distribution, the potential high computational costs of calculating all-pair attention across massive points, and the risks of over-confident predictions due to varying point density.

item.title: Byzantine-Tolerant Methods for Distributed Variational Inequalities
item.description: Robustness to Byzantine attacks is a necessity for various distributed training scenarios.

item.title: Recursion in Recursion: Two-Level Nested Recursion for Length Generalization with Scalability
item.description: For the inner recursion, we choose Beam Tree RvNNs (BT-RvNN).

item.title: DeepPatent2: A Large-Scale Benchmarking Corpus for Technical Drawing Understanding
item.description: CV tasks, such as image captioning, which has primarily been carried out on natural images, still struggle to produce accurate and meaningful captions on sketched images often included in scientific and technical documents.

item.title: SeRO: Self-Supervised Reinforcement Learning for Recovery from Out-of-Distribution Situations
item.description: Moreover, we show that our method can retrain the agent to recover from OOD situations even when in-distribution states are difficult to visit through exploration.

item.title: A Simple Interpretable Transformer for Fine-Grained Image Classification and Analysis
item.description: Unlike mainstream classifiers that wait until the last fully-connected layer to incorporate class information to make predictions, we investigate a proactive approach, asking each class to search for itself in an image.

item.title: Video Instance Matting
item.description: To remedy this deficiency, we propose Video Instance Matting~(VIM), that is, estimating alpha mattes of each instance at each frame of a video sequence.

item.title: Sub-Sentence Encoder: Contrastive Learning of Propositional Semantic Representations
item.description: We introduce sub-sentence encoder, a contrastively-learned contextual embedding model for fine-grained semantic representation of text.

item.title: Do LLMs exhibit human-like response biases? A case study in survey design
item.description: In this work, we use survey design as a case study, where human response biases caused by permutations in wordings of ``prompts'' have been extensively studied.

item.title: RobustMat: Neural Diffusion for Street Landmark Patch Matching under Challenging Environments
item.description: For autonomous vehicles (AVs), visual perception techniques based on sensors like cameras play crucial roles in information acquisition and processing.

item.title: Perceptual Quality Improvement in Videoconferencing using Keyframes-based GAN
item.description: Given that, in this context, the speaker is typically in front of the camera and remains the same for the entire duration of the transmission, we can maintain a set of reference keyframes of the person from the higher-quality I-frames that are transmitted within the video stream and exploit them to guide the visual quality improvement; a novel aspect of this approach is the update policy that maintains and updates a compact and effective set of reference keyframes.

item.title: FLORA: Fine-grained Low-Rank Architecture Search for Vision Transformer
item.description: With our method, a more fine-grained rank configuration can be generated automatically and yield up to 33% extra FLOPs reduction compared to a simple uniform configuration.

item.title: Multilingual Mathematical Autoformalization
item.description: In this work, we create $\texttt{MMA}$, a large, flexible, multilingual, and multi-domain dataset of informal-formal pairs, by using a language model to translate in the reverse direction, that is, from formal mathematical statements into corresponding informal ones.
